bibl.note: This document is a letter written from J. Pike & Company to Doctor A. King & Company dated March 16, 1836. The letter shows a listing of medicines ordered by Doctor A. King & Company from J. Pike & Company. The medicines are arriving late because of delays due to a canal being closed. Some of the medicines listed are herbs and seasonings used to create medicines. The letter is concluded by giving a recipe for wine bitter using some of the medicines named in the letter.

div1.p: Yours of 7 inst. is recd Also one in Jany ordering a bill of medicine on the rest of which we immediately put up the medicine with the expectation of being able to Send it in a few days but in Consequence of the Canal being closed we have not as yet been able to do so, the Boats are expected to Commence running in a few days when we will immediately Send it
The following is the bill as put up.
The articles not included in the above bill we have not got when we ship the med. we will again write you

add.p: For 25 Gob Wine Bitters take 2 ½ lbs Spice Bitters, 1 ½ lbs Golden Seal, 1 lb Bayberry, ¾ lb Nervine, ½ lb Cloves (fine), ¼ Annis Seed, ¼ Poplar bark, 3 oz. Cayenne, 2 ½ oz. Bitter Root,
Steep in 3 Gallons water mix with the Wine add ½ oz. oil wintergreen. Cut in alcohol, to be Stirred once a day for a week —
